sentence: Type: GEMSTEP_Observing, context:  , response: What do the bees do with pollen?
labels: Bees bring the pollen and nectar that they gather back to the hive so that it can be turned into food for the bees. Pollen is very high in protein, so they feed it to baby bees to help them develop healthy and strong.

sentence: Type: GEMSTEP_Observing, context:  , response: Why are bees carrying pollen?
labels: Bees collect pollen in little "baskets" on their legs in order to bring it back to their hive. Pollen is an important source of protein for bees!

sentence: Type: GEMSTEP_Observing, context:  , response: What happens if the hive gets full?
labels: In nature, if the hive gets full of food, some of the bees might split off and build a new hive. For bees in human-made hives, beekeepers can just take the extra honey out to leave room for new nectar to be collected.
